did.abstract: The James Herbert Morse Poetry Collection contains manuscripts and typescripts between 1873-1923 from James Herbert Morse. Having written poetry throughout his life, the collection showcases some of his verses as well as a published volume of poetry written by Morse.
did.physloc: This collection may be stored off-site. For more information on arranging to consult it, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The materials in this collection are in English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by material type. The first box is arranged chronologically. While bound, the typescripts in the second box have a considerable amount of loose pages within them as well.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born October 8, 1841 in Hubbardston, Massachusetts, James Herbert Morse was an author, educator, classical scholar, and literary figure in New York City. After attending Harvard and graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in 1863, Morse then went on to get a Masters of Arts in 1866. Two years later, he founded the Morse and Rogers Classical School in New York City where he taught students Greek and Roman literature and history. Once in New York, Morse became a prominent and active member of various literary and social organizations such as the Century Club, the Greek Club, and the Author's club, among others. In addition to his work as an educator and social figure, he wrote and published various articles, poems, and essays in publications such as Century Magazine, Harper's Monthly, The Atlantic, and the Anti-Slavery Standard, among others. In 1886, G.P. Putnam's Sons published one volume of his verses, entitled Summer Haven Songs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: In addition to the James Herbert Morse Poetry Collection, the New-York Historical Society also houses Diaries, 1866-1911 (Mss Collection BV - Morse, James) as well as the Personal Recollections of the Draft Riot of 1863, circa 1927 (Mss Collection AHMC - Morse, Lucy Gibbons) written by Morse's wife, Lucy Gibbons Morse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The James Herbert Morse Poetry Collection includes notebooks, manuscripts and typescripts, and a published volume of poetry. Spanning from 1873 to the early 1900s, the collection reflects Morse's passions for literature and creative writing, even getting a volume of his verses, entitled Summer Haven Songs, published by G.P. Putnam's Sons in 1886.
